title: dMRV Innovation for Climate Resilience with Kennedy Ng'ang'a | S4E7 📊🎧
html:
Can digital tools drive grassroots climate resilience?

In Episode 6 of Season 4, The Regeneration Nexus, of the ReFi Podcast, hosts Maya Dentzel and Tereza Bízková welcome Kennedy Ng'ang'a, founder of Shamba Network. Kennedy shares his journey of bringing blockchain and satellite data to Africa’s smallholder farmers through digital MRV (Measurement, Reporting, and Verification), aiming to make climate resilience data-driven, affordable, and community-centered.

Kennedy’s vision goes beyond tech for tech’s sake. He emphasizes that for digital tools to work, they must be practical and accessible, tailored to fit the daily realities of the communities they serve.

Shamba Network’s approach leverages satellite data as a climate resilience “oracle” to provide transparent, real-time insights for smallholder farmers. His work is a testament to the idea that when technology aligns with local needs, it can empower communities to lead their own regenerative journeys.

🌦️
“For communities on the front lines of climate change, proactive resilience is key. Rather than waiting for disaster, we’re leveraging data to trigger support ahead of time, so people can adapt, protect their resources, and emerge stronger.”

Key insights from Episode 7 include... 💡

  • Resilience Grows from Within: True climate resilience is community-led, supported by tools that respect local knowledge and empower people to make sustainable decisions for their land.
  • Democratizing Climate Finance: Digital MRV allows smallholder farmers to access climate finance, leveling the playing field by making impact data transparent, affordable, and accessible.
  • Proactive Climate Adaptation: Shamba Network’s anticipatory cash transfer model uses real-time data to trigger financial support for pastoralists before drought strikes, showcasing a proactive approach to resilience.
  • Bridging Technology and Local Knowledge: Kennedy’s approach combines advanced data with community insights, fostering a “hybrid” model that respects both technological innovation and traditional practices.
  • Rethinking Climate Verification: By bringing verification to the community level, digital MRV empowers smallholders to measure their impact reliably, making them active participants in the climate economy.
